page.description: The DRAW_BOX() function draws a box with an optional shadow.
page.syntax: V DRAW_BOX(N XPos,N YPos,N Width,N Height,C box_border,C fill_color,C border_color[,N line_width[,C Shadow_style[,N shadow_width[,C shadow_color]]]])

argument.name: XPos
argument.description: The horizontal coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle.

argument.name: YPos
argument.description: The vertical coordinate of the upper left corner of the rectangle.

argument.name: box_border
argument.description: The style of the border. The style may be any of the following:

argument.name: fill_color
argument.description: The fill color of the rectangle.

argument.name: border_color
argument.description: The border color of the rectangle.

argument.name: line_width
argument.description: Optional. Default = 0. The width of the border in pixels.

argument.name: Shadow_style
argument.description: Optional. Default = No shadow. The style may any of the following:

argument.name: shadow_color
argument.description: Optional. Default = "black". The color of the shadow.

section.description: The DRAW_BOX() function draws a box with an optional shadow.

section.title: Examples
section.example: ui_bitmap_create("test", 4, 2) ui_bitmap_draw("test",<<%code% inner_Rect(0, 0, 4, 2) text("Thin", .75, .25,"center") text("Medium", 2, .25,"center") text("Thick", 3.25, .25,"center") draw_box(.25, .5, 1, 1, "SINGLE", "white", "black", 1, "SHADOW", 1, "gray") draw_box(1.50, .5, 1, 1, "SINGLE", "white", "black", 1, "SHADOW", 2, "gray") draw_box(2.75, .5, 1, 1, "SINGLE", "white", "black", 1, "SHADOW", 3, "gray") %code%) ui_dlg_box("","{image=test}")

section.description: Drawing a gradient with all shades of blue.
section.example:
dim vlen as N dim hlen as N dim steps as N hlen = 1 vlen = 4 steps = 256 ui_bitmap_create("foo", hlen, vlen) ui_bitmap_Draw("foo",<<%code% for i = 0 to (steps - 1) y1 = (vlen * i) / steps
y2 = (vlen * (i + 1)) / steps
set_brush("#0, 0, " + i)
inner_rect(0, y1, hlen, y2) next %code%) ui_dlg_box("","{image=foo}")

page.limitations: Used only in the Code sections of UI_BITMAP_DRAW(), UI_SCREEN_DRAW(), and UI_PRINTER_DRAW().
